programme.title: Voetbalpraatjes
programme.desc: Presentatrice Fresia Cousiño Arias ontvangt drie jonge voetbalvolgers in de setting van Voetbalpraat. Geen tactische analyses of ingewikkelde statistieken, maar voetbal zoals kinderen het beleven: spontaan, vrolijk en enthousiast. Voetbalpraatjes neemt de kijker mee in de voetbalbeleving van kinderen, die onder anderen reageren op stellingen van bekende spelers en speelsters. En in de rubriek "Warmlopers" krijgen kinderen een exclusief kijkje achter de schermen.

programme.title: Voetbalpraatjes
programme.desc: Presentatrice Fresia Cousiño Arias ontvangt drie jonge voetbalvolgers in de setting van Voetbalpraat. Geen tactische analyses of ingewikkelde statistieken, maar voetbal zoals kinderen het beleven: spontaan, vrolijk en enthousiast. Voetbalpraatjes neemt de kijker mee in de voetbalbeleving van kinderen, die onder anderen reageren op stellingen van bekende spelers en speelsters. En in de rubriek "Warmlopers" krijgen kinderen een exclusief kijkje achter de schermen.

programme.title: Voetbalpraatjes
programme.desc: Presentatrice Fresia Cousiño Arias ontvangt drie jonge voetbalvolgers in de setting van Voetbalpraat. Geen tactische analyses of ingewikkelde statistieken, maar voetbal zoals kinderen het beleven: spontaan, vrolijk en enthousiast. Voetbalpraatjes neemt de kijker mee in de voetbalbeleving van kinderen, die onder anderen reageren op stellingen van bekende spelers en speelsters. En in de rubriek "Warmlopers" krijgen kinderen een exclusief kijkje achter de schermen.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The Aggies (6-6) and Cougars (6-6) take to the blue turf of Albertsons Stadium for the Famous Idaho Potato Bowl. Utah State fell to Georgia State 45-22 in 2023, dropping its Potato Bowl record to 1-4. Washington State topped Utah State 49-28 in 2024.

programme.title: Live: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.desc: An in-depth look at Monday's game and reviews of Sunday's games.

programme.title: Live: NFL Football
programme.desc: Philip Rivers is thrust into the national spotlight as his Colts (8-6) host the 49ers (10-4). Rivers, 44, returned from a five-year absence from pro football in Week 15, throwing for 120 yards and touchdown as Indianapolis lost 18-16 at Seattle.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The Cardinals (8-4) line up against the Rockets (8-4) in the Boca Raton Bowl. Toledo won bowl games in two of the last three years, moving to 2-0 at the Boca Raton Bowl by beating Liberty in 2022. The Rockets are riding a four-game win streak.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The Hilltoppers and Golden Eagles descend on the Crescent City to compete in the New Orleans Bowl. Western Kentucky has won all four meetings, including 45-28 in the 2015 Conference USA championship game. Southern Miss moved to the Sun Belt in 2022.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The Rebels play the Bobcats in the Frisco Bowl. Ohio rides a six-game bowl winning streak, and won this event by shutting out San Diego State in 2018. UNLV had won four in a row prior to its loss at Boise State in the Mountain West title game.

programme.desc: The 2025 Formula One season comes down to a decisive Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. After winning in Qatar, four-time defending World Drivers' Champion Max Verstappen sits 12 points behind Lando Norris. Norris claims his first WDC title with a podium finish.

programme.title: Live: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Golden State Warriors look to snap a two-game skid as they host the Orlando Magic at Chase Center. Magic guard Desmond Bane scored 23 points and five steals in the last match. Magic forward Tristan da Silva has been ruled out due to injury.

programme.desc: For multiple drivers heading into the 2025 Indy 500, this is the moment they've been waiting 365 days for. Everyone behind the wheel is looking to fight off past ghosts. After a second place finish in '22 and '24, can O Ward finally kiss the bricks? Is it time for Dixon to get his second victory after nearly two decades? programme.title: Live: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: Live: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Live: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Hudson Square in Lower Manhattan, a modern media hub for ESPN and The Walt Disney Company's New York-based teams. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: Live: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith hosts this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Presenting the latest news from the world of sports.

programme.title: The Hoop Collective
programme.desc: Brian Windhorst is joined by Tim MacMahon, Tim Bontemps, and other insiders to sort out life in and around the NBA world.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: Inside the College Football Playoff
programme.desc: An all-access series gives viewers a glimpse into each of the top four teams' preparation leading up to and through the semifinals and national championship.

programme.title: Not So Fast, My Friend: A Lee Corso Special
programme.desc: Before Lee Corso makes his final headgear pick on "College GameDay," ESPN honors the reputed broadcaster, who has been connected to the sport for more than 75 years.

programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on notable sports happenings.

programme.title: Live: SportsCenter
programme.desc: Las últimas noticias, momentos destacados e información de todos los rincones del mundo del deporte se presenta cada día en "SportsCenter", el primer programa de ESPN cuando la red se estrenó en septiembre de 1979. La serie se transmite en tres ediciones nocturnas, luego se re-transmite la última edición cuatro veces cada mañana de lunes a viernes antes de despejar el escenario para un bloque de seis horas de "SportsCenter" en vivo, que pone más énfasis en la interactividad de los fanáticos, noticias, análisis, comentarios y la cobertura de las conferencias de prensa.

programme.desc: La mesa más picante discute las últimas novedades del fútbol mexicano y analiza la actuación de los futbolistas mexicanos en el exterior.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: Las últimas noticias, momentos destacados e información de todos los rincones del mundo del deporte se presenta cada día en "SportsCenter", el primer programa de ESPN cuando la red se estrenó en septiembre de 1979. La serie se transmite en tres ediciones nocturnas, luego se re-transmite la última edición cuatro veces cada mañana de lunes a viernes antes de despejar el escenario para un bloque de seis horas de "SportsCenter" en vivo, que pone más énfasis en la interactividad de los fanáticos, noticias, análisis, comentarios y la cobertura de las conferencias de prensa.

programme.title: María, llena eres de fuerza
programme.desc: Las historias más conmovedoras del mundo del deporte. El documental entra en la vida de los atletas, sus momentos icónicos y el impacto cultural del deporte.

programme.title: The Kingdom
programme.desc: Tras la trayectoria de Patrick Mahomes, que ha pasado de ser hijo de un jugador de béisbol a convertirse en una superestrella del fútbol americano, los Chiefs comienzan su lucha por el tercer título consecutivo del Super Bowl.

programme.title: The Kingdom
programme.desc: Guiado por la determinación y la convicción de que siempre hay una segunda oportunidad, el legendario entrenador de los Chiefs, Andy Reid, ha encontrado en los lazos familiares la fuerza para superar los momentos álgidos de la victoria.

programme.title: The Kingdom
programme.desc: En el partido más esperado de la temporada regular, los Chiefs se enfrentan a sus rivales de la AFC, los Bills de Josh Allen.

programme.title: The Kingdom
programme.desc: La lesión de tobillo de Patrick Mahomes aumenta la presión sobre Chris Jones y la defensa de los Chiefs. El partido del día de Navidad contra los Pittsburgh Steelers es muy importante de cara a la postemporada.

programme.title: The Kingdom
programme.desc: Con el apoyo incondicional de Chiefs Kingdom, Kansas City se llevó la victoria en casa en la fase de eliminatorias contra los Texans. Su recompensa es una revancha en el Campeonato de la AFC contra los Buffalo Bills.

programme.title: The Kingdom
programme.desc: Los Chiefs llegan a Nueva Orleans a punto de hacer historia en la Super Bowl. En su camino hacia el triplete se interponen los Philadelphia Eagles, que no tienen intención de quedarse en un segundo plano en este final de cuento de hadas.

programme.title: Marketplace Europe
programme.sub-title: Europe's Unicorns at Web Summit Lisbon
programme.desc: Web Summit has become the must-attend conference in Europe for the tech world. For founders, investors, policymakers and startups, it provides a front-row seat for the tech debates that will shape our future. Europe continues to lag behind when it comes to unicorns - while the U.S. has around 800 startups valued at over $1billion, Europe has just over 200 - but that number has been growing with the AI boom, so we sat down with some of those leading lights in the continent's tech scene.

programme.title: Marketplace Asia
programme.desc: We visit FII Priority Asia 2025 in Tokyo, where technology, AI, and investment take center stage in shaping the region's future. In Taiwan, Will Ripley visits semiconductor giant TSMC's annual sports day to see what it means for the company.

programme.title: More Than A Game
programme.desc: We explore how Abu Dhabi has rapidly transformed itself into one of the world's premier hubs for mixed martial arts. We trace the emirate's journey from building grassroots programs and training centers to hosting global events and forging landmark partnerships with organizations like the UFC. Through local fighters, coaches, and industry voices, we reveal how the sport has evolved from niche to mainstream, shaping new opportunities, and inspiring young athletes.

programme.title: Call to Earth
programme.desc: Our waterways often bear the brunt of modern-day human negligence. Most of India's ponds, lakes and oceans are polluted or contaminated due to human activity. Led by founder Arun Krishnamurthy, Environmentalist Foundation of India (EFI) focuses on reviving these bodies of water through a community-based conservation effort, with their work now extending into the surrounding forest ecosystems.

programme.title: Inside...
programme.sub-title: Uzbekistan: The Center of Islamic Civilization
programme.desc: The Center for Islamic Civilization in Tashkent stands at the intersection of culture, history, and faith. It's a place where Uzbekistan's rich intellectual and artistic heritage meets the possibilities of the future. Through conversations with scholars, curators and craftspeople, we see how an idea conceived nearly a decade ago has grown into a national center dedicated to rediscovering the spirit of the Islamic Golden Age.

Through conversations with scholars, curators and craftspeople, we see how an idea conceived nearly a decade ago has grown into a national center dedicated to rediscovering the spirit of the Islamic Golden Age.

programme.title: Inside Africa
programme.desc: A journey across Africa, exploring the true diversity and depth of different cultures, countries and regions.

programme.title: Marketplace Europe
programme.sub-title: Europe's Unicorns at Web Summit Lisbon
programme.desc: Web Summit has become the must-attend conference in Europe for the tech world. For founders, investors, policymakers and startups, it provides a front-row seat for the tech debates that will shape our future. Europe continues to lag behind when it comes to unicorns - while the U.S. has around 800 startups valued at over $1billion, Europe has just over 200 - but that number has been growing with the AI boom, so we sat down with some of those leading lights in the continent's tech scene.

programme.desc: Filmed at a sold-out Majestic Theater in Brooklyn, N.Y., comedian Martin Lawrence delivers his first full-length stand-up special. Harking back to Eddie Murphy, the leather-clad comic riffs on drugs, jail, his impoverished upbringing with his mother and his luck -- or lack thereof -- with women. He also speaks at length about racism and the Rodney King ruling and subsequent riots. Lawrence even offers his unique perspective on how to maintain a successful relationship.

programme.title: Volunteers
programme.desc: Hoping to avoid gambling debts, rich playboy Lawrence Bourne (Tom Hanks) stows away on a plane of Peace Corps volunteers set for Thailand. programme.title: Lady in the Lake
programme.desc: Private eye Phillip Marlowe (Robert Montgomery) wants to get out of the detective racket and into crime writing. But when he's called to the office of editor Adrienne Fromsett (Audrey Totter), it's not to talk about his story ideas -- she wants him to locate the missing wife of her boss, Mr. Kingsby (Leon Ames). The assignment quickly becomes complicated when bodies start turning up. This Raymond Chandler adaptation is notable for being filmed entirely from Marlowe's first-person perspective.

programme.title: Alias Boston Blackie
programme.desc: Reformed thief Boston Blackie (Chester Morris) organizes a Christmas show for inmates at a prison. The troupe he assembles for the performance includes pretty dancer Eve Sanders (Adele Mara), a group of musicians and a clown. Things go awry when prisoners abduct the clown and replace him with a convict looking to escape. Then, a murder is committed, and investigator Inspector Farrady (Richard Lane) becomes suspicious of Blackie, who must find the real killer in order to exonerate himself.

programme.title: Cover Up
programme.desc: An insurance sleuth (Dennis O'Keefe) probes a small-town suicide, senses hostility and suspects murder.

programme.title: The Curse of the Cat People
programme.desc: In this sequel to "Cat People," Oliver Reed (Kent Smith) is married to the lovely Alice Moore (Jane Randolph). The couple has a daughter, Amy (Ann Carter), a withdrawn young girl with a vivid imagination who soon begins talking to visions of her father's deceased former wife, the cursed Irena (Simone Simon). When Amy unintentionally incurs the wrath of a mentally unstable woman (Elizabeth Russell), the girl's relationship with Irena's apparition comes into play.

programme.title: Hell's Heroes
programme.desc: After a foursome rob a bank, killing a clerk and losing a crew member in the act, they flee into the desert. While wandering, they stumble upon a woman in labor. Before she dies giving birth, she makes them promise to bring the baby to its father -- the man they killed at the bank. Robert (Charles Bickford), after he loses his other two accomplices, is determined to uphold his vow and save the child, but with limited resources and the law on his back, his odds of success aren't good.

programme.title: A Christmas Carol
programme.desc: Crotchety miser Ebenezer Scrooge (Reginald Owen) hates Christmas and mistreats his long-suffering employee, devoted family man Bob Cratchit (Gene Lockhart). But a visit from the ghost of his former business partner Jacob Marley (Leo G. Carroll) and three Christmas spirits (Lionel Braham, Ann Rutherford, D'Arcy Corrigan) might convince him to change his ways and become more kindhearted. This adaptation of the Charles Dickens classic became a holiday staple for decades.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: Room for One More
programme.desc: Poppy (Cary Grant) and Anna Rose (Betsy Drake) have a soft spot for young people in need. Despite having three children of their own, they can't help but take action when they meet a pair of troubled young orphans. Young Jane (Iris Mann) is horribly depressed, while Jimmy (Clifford Tatum Jr.) is physically disabled and has a long history as a troublemaker. As they welcome the pair into their home, the Roses use love and understanding to help the orphans get to the bottom of their problems.

programme.title: Susan Slept Here
programme.desc: A penniless Hollywood scriptwriter agrees to look after a rebellious teenage girl at Christmas in order to help with his research for film about juvenile delinquency. The troublesome girl causes all kinds of problems, not the least of which is setting the writer's girlfriend on fire with jealousy.

programme.title: Desk Set
programme.desc: Bunny Watson (Katharine Hepburn) is a library reference clerk stuck in a dead-end relationship with a boring television executive (Gig Young). Her life is thrown into turmoil when computer expert Richard Summers (Spencer Tracy) enters it. He has been assigned with automating her department, and she is fearful that Summers' new computers will automate her out of a job. She despises him at first, but eventually each of the two start to fall for the other's charms and strong personalities.

programme.title: Going My Way
programme.desc: Father Charles O'Malley (Bing Crosby) is an easy-going, golf-playing young priest whose entry into a tough neighborhood parish in midtown Manhattan is viewed with skepticism from all quarters, especially the aging Father Fitzgibbon (Barry Fitzgerald). While dealing with some unfinished business from his former life in the form of an old flame who now sings at the Metropolitan Opera (Rise Stevens), Father O'Malley inspires the youth of his parish by forming a boys choir.

programme.title: The Bells of St. Mary's
programme.desc: Father O'Malley (Bing Crosby) is transferred to the Roman Catholic inner-city school St. Mary's, where he quickly falls into conflict with its headmistress, Sister Mary (Ingrid Bergman). Their primary disagreement has to do with the deteriorating school itself. Father O'Malley feels it should be abandoned and the children sent to other schools. Sister Mary and the other nuns, however, believe there is still hope, possibly in the form of charity from a wealthy business owner (Henry Travers).

programme.title: Gold Diggers of 1933
programme.desc: Things get tough for Carol (Joan Blondell) and her showgirl pals (Ruby Keeler, Aline MacMahon) when the Great Depression kicks in and all the Broadway shows close down. Wealthy songwriter Brad (Dick Powell) saves the day by funding a new Depression-themed musical for the girls to star in, but when his stuffy high-society brother finds out and threatens to disown Brad, Carol and her gold-digging friends scheme to keep the show going, hooking a couple of millionaires along the way.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: Call Her Savage
programme.desc: Actually the offspring of a Native American man and a white woman, tempestuous Texas heiress Nasa Springer (Clara Bow) grows up believing her father to be Pete Springer (Willard Robertson), a railroad tycoon. When her dad ships his emotionally troubled daughter off to a girls' school in Chicago, and later arranges a marriage for Nasa, she defies him by wedding a drunken cad (Monroe Owsley). After the marriage crumbles and she turns up pregnant, Nasa's life spirals out of control.

programme.title: There Ain't No Santa Claus
programme.desc: Charley has several dilemmas caused by his greedy landlord.

programme.title: Christmas Past
programme.desc: Compilation of silent film shorts about Christmas.

programme.title: Mon Oncle Antoine
programme.desc: Benoit (Jacques Gagnon) is an adolescent in the care of his uncle, Antoine (Jean Duceppe), who runs a general store in a small mining town in Quebec. To make some extra money, Antoine doubles as the town's undertaker. During the Christmas shopping rush, Benoit helps out at the store, learning a lot about himself in the process. When he accompanies his uncle to pick up a body of a local boy who has recently died, he is faced with his own mortality, and realizes that life is fleeting.

programme.title: Period of Adjustment
programme.desc: Veteran George Haverstick (Jim Hutton) meets nurse Isabel (Jane Fonda) while in hospital and soon marries her. However, Isabel is disappointed to learn that George drives a hearse and has booked them a dingy motel for their honeymoon, during which he falls asleep drunk. The next day, the couple visits George's friend Ralph (Tony Franciosa), who originally married Dorothea (Lois Nettleton) for money but now loves her. Dorothea wants to leave Ralph, and the Haversticks try to help him.

programme.title: Blossoms in the Dust
programme.desc: Edna Gladney lost her son when he was very young. By chance she discovered the injustice within the law towards children whose parents are unknown, and decided to open an orphanage for these children, despite the stigma. She fought against the unfair laws that discriminated against children born out of wedlock.

programme.title: The Daughter of Rosie O'Grady
programme.desc: An Irish horsecar driver's daughter (June Haver) meets New York showman Tony Pastor (Gordon MacRae) and goes into vaudeville.

programme.title: Our Vines Have Tender Grapes
programme.desc: A Wisconsin farming family takes on the struggles and rewards of rural life. Martinius Jacobson (Edward G. Robinson) is a humble Norwegian farmer, working his small farm with only the help of his wife, Bruna (Agnes Moorehead), and his young daughter, Selma (Margaret O'Brien). Selma and her cousin, Arnold (Jackie "Butch" Jenkins), witness many dramatic episodes over the course of a year, including a neighbor's barn fire, a raging flood and a brief visit from a traveling circus elephant.

programme.title: Metropolitan
programme.desc: A radical student is adopted by a group of young New Yorkers, serves as a catalyst to alter his and their lives. Gathering in a Manhattan apartment, the group of friends meet to discuss social mobility, Fourier's socialism and play bridge in their cocoon of upper-class society - until they are joined by a man with a critical view of their way of life.

programme.title: The World of Henry Orient
programme.desc: While trying to seduce a married woman (Paula Prentiss), egotistical concert pianist Henry Orient (Peter Sellers) is interrupted by two precocious schoolgirls, Valerie (Tippy Walker) and Marian (Merrie Spaeth). At first he thinks nothing of it, but as he sees them more often, he becomes convinced they're spies for his lover's husband. The girls, meanwhile, have found out who he is, and Valerie insists she's in love. She starts a scrapbook, which her mother finds and, of course, misconstrues.

programme.title: The Trouble With Angels
programme.desc: Mary (Hayley Mills) and her friend, Rachel (June Harding), are new students at St. Francis Academy, a boarding school run by the iron fist of Mother Superior (Rosalind Russell). The immature teens grow bored and begin playing pranks on both the unsuspecting nuns and their unpleasant classmates, becoming a constant thorn in Mother Superior's side. However, as the years pass, Mary and Rachel slowly mature and begin to see the nuns in a different light.

programme.title: Never Say Goodbye
programme.desc: Young "Flip" Gayley (Patti Brady) thinks her parents will reunite if her father, Phil (Errol Flynn), believes her mother, Ellen (Eleanor Parker), has a romantic life. Ellen, however, isn't seeing anyone. Flip sends her soldier pen pal a photo of her mother, hoping he'll believe he's been corresponding with Ellen all along. Ellen and the soldier soon find themselves in the same restaurant as Phil. Instantly jealous, Phil schemes to replace the man he fears is about to steal Ellen's heart.

programme.title: It Happened on 5th Avenue
programme.desc: While rich businessman Mike O'Connor (Charles Ruggles) resides in Virginia, his luxury townhouse in New York City appears vacant. However, in reality, drifter Aloysius "Mac" McKeever (Victor Moore) has been staying there. Mac invites Jim (Don DeFore), an unemployed veteran who has just been evicted from a building owned by O'Connor, to stay at the house without revealing he's squatting. When O'Connor's daughter, Trudy (Gale Storm), shows up as well, she falls for Jim and tries to help him.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: While on a speaking tour in Ohio, opinionated and arrogant radio personality Sheridan Whiteside (Monty Woolley) injures himself slipping on ice and becomes an unexpected houseguest for a prominent area family, the Stanleys. Whiteside proceeds to make brash proclamations and offer his unsolicited advice to the family members. When a romance begins between Whiteside's assistant, Maggie Cutler (Bette Davis), and a local reporter, Bert Jefferson (Richard Travis), he interferes with that as well.

programme.title: Fitzwilly
programme.desc: In this clever 1960s comedy, tireless and loyal butler Fitzwilly (Dick Van Dyke) hides from his eccentric spinster boss, Victoria Woodhouse (Edith Evans), the fact that she has been bankrupt since her father died. Through wily schemes with his fellow servants, he creates one racket, swindle or con after another to maintain the household and fund his employer's frivolous philanthropy. When new secretary Juliet (Barbara Feldon) is hired on, Fitzwilly's life gets even more complicated.

programme.title: Lady on a Train
programme.desc: Young, pleasant Nikki Collins (Deanna Durbin) witnesses a brutal murder while riding on a train on her way to New York City. Though she desperately tries to inform others of what she saw, no one believes her. In her scramble to convince someone, anyone, of the crime, she finds an ally in a mystery writer named Wayne Morgan (David Bruce). Trapped as she is on the train, however, the more she tries to raise the alarm, the more attention she draws to herself -- and the killer is starting to notice.

programme.title: Miracle on Main Street
programme.desc: The discovery of an abandoned baby on Christmas Eve brings new meaning to a lonely and depressed Los Angeles dancer.

rating.system: Instituto de Cinematografía y de las Artes Visuales

programme.title: Roadblock
programme.desc: Joe Peters (Charles McGraw) is resigned to his modest life as a low-level insurance agent when he meets the coldly beautiful Diane (Joan Dixon), whose high-maintenance ways and luxurious tastes are more than he can afford. Desperate to be with her, even as she flaunts her relationship with a powerful gangster (Lowell Gilmore), Joe plans a dangerous bank robbery that goes terribly wrong. As the police close in, both Joe and Diane come to a startling conclusion.

programme.title: Kind Lady
programme.desc: Mary (Aline MacMahon), an elderly woman with good intentions, takes pity on Henry (Basil Rathbone), an artist with no home. What begins as a simple offer to come inside from the cold for tea gradually turns into more. Before the unsuspecting woman knows it, Henry has convinced Mary to pay for doctor visits. It spirals out of control when Henry, his family and friends con their way into her home. Eventually, Mary creates a ruse to rid herself of the parasites, but they have a different plan.

programme.title: And So They Were Married
programme.desc: Bratty children prevent their single parents (Melvyn Douglas, Mary Astor) from marrying, but regret it later.

programme.title: The Man I Love
programme.desc: A nightclub singer becomes involved in an accidental death as a petty racketeer tries to force his attentions on her.

programme.title: Larceny, Inc.
programme.desc: When ex-convict Pressure Maxwell (Edward G. Robinson) is denied the loan he was seeking in order to start his own business, he resolves to rob the bank instead. With the help of his pals Jug Martin (Broderick Crawford) and Weepy Davis (Edward Brophy), he engineers a car accident to raise enough money to buy the luggage store next to the bank. The group then begins burrowing through the basement into the bank, but their plans are disrupted by the unanticipated success of their business.

programme.title: Backfire
programme.desc: A World War II veteran (Gordon MacRae) and his nurse (Virginia Mayo) search for his buddy (Edmond O'Brien), a reformed hoodlum on the run.

programme.title: Mr. Soft Touch
programme.desc: A World War II veteran, Joe Miracle (Glenn Ford), comes home to find that his nightclub has been taken over by gangsters and his business partner has been killed. After reclaiming the money that is rightfully his, he is forced to hide out in a settlement house due to a case of mistaken identity. There, he befriends the house manager, Jenny Jones (Evelyn Keyes). While being pursued by gangsters and a persistent journalist, Joe learns a valuable lesson about altruism.

programme.title: My Reputation
programme.desc: Jessica Drummond (Barbara Stanwyck) is grieving after her husband's death and attempting to raise two sons alone. While on a ski holiday, she meets and falls for Maj. Scott Landis (George Brent). Their relationship is short-lived, and Jessica returns home and starts dating a new man, Frank Everett (Warner Anderson). But, when Scott moves into town, romantic confusion sets in. At the same time, community gossip about the recently widowed woman's love life threatens to tear her family apart.

programme.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
programme.desc: "Meet Me in St. Louis" is a classic MGM romantic musical comedy that focuses on four sisters (one of whom is the nonpareil Judy Garland) on the cusp of the 1904 St. Louis World's Fair. The film spotlights the sisters' education in the ways of the world, which includes, but isn't limited to, learning about life and love, courtesy of the prototypical boy next door. In the end, love -- accompanied by song, dance and period costumes, all in glorious Technicolor -- conquers all.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: In the Good Old Summertime
programme.desc: In this musical romance, lovely Veronica Fisher (Judy Garland) lands a job in Otto Oberkugen's (S.Z. Sakall) music store in turn-of-the-century Chicago. Though the other employees like her, including Otto's clumsy nephew Hickey (Buster Keaton), salesman Andrew Larkin (Van Johnson) -- who is threatened by her competition, and secretly attracted to her -- greets her coolly. Each of them is carrying on a romantic correspondence with an as-yet-to-be-met pen pal. They are both in for a surprise.

programme.title: Meet John Doe
programme.desc: A reporter writes a fictitious column about a man named John Doe, who claims to despair at America's neglect of the little people and plans to kill himself. To maintain the ruse, the newspaper hires a ballplayer-turned-hobo to pose as John Doe.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: The March sisters -- Meg (Janet Leigh), Jo (June Allyson), Beth (Margaret O'Brien) and Amy (Elizabeth Taylor) -- struggle to make ends meet in their New England household while their father is away fighting in the Civil War. Despite harsh times, they cling to optimism, often with neighbor Laurie (Peter Lawford) as a companion. As they mature, they face burgeoning ambitions and relationships, as well as tragedy, all the while maintaining their unbreakable bond.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: Auntie Mame
programme.desc: Mame Dennis (Rosalind Russell), a progressive and independent woman of the 1920s, is left to care for her nephew Patrick (Jan Handzlik/Roger Smith) after his wealthy father dies. Mr. Babcock (Fred Clark), Patrick's assigned executor, objects to Mame's unconventional way of living and tries to force her to send Patrick to prep school. As Mame and Patrick grow closer, Mr. Babcock tries to discipline Patrick and threatens to separate the two if Mame does not comply with his wishes.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: Three Godfathers
programme.desc: In a town called New Jerusalem, bandits Bob Sangster (Chester Morris), Doc Underwood (Lewis Stone) and Gus Barton (Walter Brennan) hold up a bank. After a gun battle with the townspeople, the three robbers retreat into the scorching desert. There, they happen upon an ill woman stranded with her child. As the mother dies, she begs the men to take care of her infant. The fugitives want to save the baby -- but to do so, they'll have to travel back to New Jerusalem, where they are wanted men.

programme.title: Bachelor Mother
programme.desc: Polly Paris (Ginger Rogers) accidentally stumbles into motherhood after discovering an abandoned baby on the steps of an orphanage. Believing the baby is Polly's, department store owner J.B. Merlin (Charles Coburn) and his son David (David Niven) offer Polly a job -- but only if she takes responsibility for the child. Unemployed and in need of work, Polly accepts and all seems well, until her increasingly romantic relationship with David raises suspicions about the child's paternity.

programme.title: All Mine to Give
programme.desc: In this fact-based drama set in the 1850s, the Eunsons move from Scotland to the American Midwest, where they live happily and run a successful business -- until the untimely deaths of both the father (Cameron Mitchell) and the mother (Glynis Johns) of the family. Now orphaned, the six Eunson kids must fend for themselves. Robbie (Rex Thompson), the oldest, does his best to care for his siblings while he searches for foster parents kind enough to accept such a large family into their home.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: The Shop Around the Corner
programme.desc: Alfred Kralik (James Stewart) and Klara Novak (Margaret Sullavan) are employees at Matuschek and Company, a general store in Budapest. Klara and Alfred are constantly at odds with each other, butting heads and disagreeing on almost everything. Both are enamored of their respective pen pals, who serve as welcome distractions in their lives. Little do they know, they are each the other's pen pal and, despite outward differences, have unwittingly fallen in love through their letters.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: It Happened on 5th Avenue
programme.desc: While rich businessman Mike O'Connor (Charles Ruggles) resides in Virginia, his luxury townhouse in New York City appears vacant. However, in reality, drifter Aloysius "Mac" McKeever (Victor Moore) has been staying there. Mac invites Jim (Don DeFore), an unemployed veteran who has just been evicted from a building owned by O'Connor, to stay at the house without revealing he's squatting. When O'Connor's daughter, Trudy (Gale Storm), shows up as well, she falls for Jim and tries to help him.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: Holiday Affair
programme.desc: Charming seasonal clerk Steve Mason (Robert Mitchum) catches beautiful Connie Ennis (Janet Leigh) in a fraudulent shopping scheme during the busy Christmas rush. But when he discovers that Ennis is a war widow and single mother, Mason takes pity on her and can't bring himself to turn her in. His supervisor takes notice and fires him on the spot. Mason befriends Connie and her young son, Timmy (Gordon Gebert), and may complicate her plans to marry boring nice guy Carl Davis (Wendell Corey).

programme.title: Christmas in Connecticut
programme.desc: While recovering in a hospital, war hero Jefferson Jones (Dennis Morgan) grows familiar with the Diary of a Housewife column written by Elizabeth Lane (Barbara Stanwyck). Jeff's nurse arranges with Elizabeth's publisher, Alexander Yardley (Sydney Greenstreet), for Jeff to spend the holiday at Elizabeth's bucolic Connecticut farm with her husband and child. But the column is a sham, so Yardley hastens to arrange a publicity ploy by setting up single, nondomestic Elizabeth on a country farm.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: The Bishop's Wife
programme.desc: Dejected by his efforts to raise money to build a cathedral, Bishop Henry Brougham (David Niven) beseeches heaven for guidance, and is visited immediately by Dudley (Cary Grant), who claims to be an angel. Henry is skeptical, then annoyed when Dudley ingratiates himself into the household as his assistant -- and worse, wins the attentions of Henry's long-suffering and kindly wife (Loretta Young). When Dudley continues to intervene in Henry's struggles, the bishop decides to challenge heaven.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: An Affair to Remember
programme.desc: A man and a woman have a romance while on a cruise from Europe to New York. Despite being engaged to other people, both agree to reunite at the top of the Empire State Building in six months. However, an unfortunate accident keeps her from the reunion, and he fears that she has married or does not love him anymore.

rating.system: Departamento de Justiça, Classificação, Títulos e Qualificação

programme.title: A Christmas Carol
programme.desc: Crotchety miser Ebenezer Scrooge (Reginald Owen) hates Christmas and mistreats his long-suffering employee, devoted family man Bob Cratchit (Gene Lockhart). But a visit from the ghost of his former business partner Jacob Marley (Leo G. Carroll) and three Christmas spirits (Lionel Braham, Ann Rutherford, D'Arcy Corrigan) might convince him to change his ways and become more kindhearted. This adaptation of the Charles Dickens classic became a holiday staple for decades.

programme.title: Miguel Soler
programme.desc: Niewielu hiszpańskich zawodników może pochwalić się tak bogatym i zarazem kontrowersyjnym CV, jak Miguel Soler. Piłkarz występował między innymi w RCD Espanyolu, FC Barcelonie i w Realu Madryt.

programme.title: Liga portugalska - mecz: Vitoria SC - Sporting CP
Unikalne tradycje LaLiga
programme.desc: Twórcy przedstawiają tradycje związane z ligą hiszpańską. Jedną z nich jest zwyczaj, według którego drużyny przyjezdne, przed meczem z Athletikiem w Bilbao, składały kwiaty pod popiersiem Pichichiego.

programme.title: Mityczne stadiony LaLiga
programme.desc: Widzowie odbędą podróż po najsłynniejszych arenach piłkarskich w Hiszpanii. Kamera zajrzy m.in. na stadiony Camp Nou i Santiago Bernabeu, na których swoje mecze rozgrywają FC Barcelona i Real Madryt.

programme.title: Rywalizacje konieczne
programme.desc: Opowieść o rywalizacjach klubów z jednego miasta lub regionu. Twórcy dokumentu przybliżą kulisy m.in. derbów Sewilli czy Kraju Basków. Przy okazji spróbują opisać emocje, jakie się z nimi wiążą.

programme.title: LaLiga Best 11
programme.desc: Twórcy programu typują najlepszą jedenastkę piłkarzy, którzy zapisali się złotymi zgłoskami w historii Primera Division.

programme.title: Premier League: The Big Interview
programme.desc: Trenerzy oraz zawodnicy, których możemy oglądać na boiskach Premier League, przybliżą perspektywę na boiskowe wydarzenia, opowiedzą o drodze na sam szczyt i pierwszych chwilach w nowych zespołach.

programme.title: Piłka nożna: Liga hiszpańska - mecz: Real Madryt CF - Sevilla FC
Byłem królem
programme.desc: Seria przybliżająca sylwetki najlepszych strzelców w historii piłkarskiej ekstraklasy. To wspaniała okazja do przypomnienia sobie sukcesów Włodzimierza Lubańskiego, Grzegorza Laty, Kazimierza Kmiecika, Grzegorza Piechny i Tomasza Frankowskiego. Poznamy różne piłkarskie pokolenia. W latach 60. XX wieku cztery raz z rzędu królem strzelców był Włodzimierz Lubański (Górnik Zabrze). Natomiast w latach 70. królowali Kazimierz Kmiecik (Wisła Kraków) i Grzegorz Lato (Stal Mielec). W czasach bardziej współczesnych cztery tytuły na koncie zanotował Tomasz Frankowski w barwach Wisły Kraków i Jagiellonii Białystok. Nie zabraknie też historii Grzegorza Piechny, niespodziewanego króla strzelców z Korony Kielce w 2006 roku.

programme.title: Magazyn PGE Ekstraliga
programme.desc: Cotygodniowy magazyn poświęcony rozgrywkom żużlowej PGE Ekstraligi. Podsumowuje on każdą kolejkę. Nie zabraknie w nim skrótów meczów, ciekawostek oraz materiałów zakulisowych.

programme.desc: Trenerzy oraz zawodnicy, których możemy oglądać na boiskach Premier League, przybliżą perspektywę na boiskowe wydarzenia, opowiedzą o drodze na sam szczyt i pierwszych chwilach w nowych zespołach.

programme.title: Boks: Walka o pas WBA w Dubaju - waga ciężka: Kubrat Pulev - Murat Gassiev
Premier League Stories
programme.desc: Historie piłkarzy, trenerów, zespołów, a także sędziów jednej z największych lig na świecie. Poznamy nieznane wcześniej fakty. Przybliżone zostaną sylwetki prawdziwych legend rozgrywek Premier League.

programme.title: Premier League: The Big Interview
programme.desc: Trenerzy oraz zawodnicy, których możemy oglądać na boiskach Premier League, przybliżą perspektywę na boiskowe wydarzenia, opowiedzą o drodze na sam szczyt i pierwszych chwilach w nowych zespołach.

programme.title: Jej Wysokość Premier League
programme.desc: Program poświęcony lidze angielskiej. Prowadzący wraz z gośćmi obejrzy wszystkie bramki ostatniej kolejki i omówi jej najciekawsze spotkanie. Magazyn składa się z kilku bloków tematycznych.

Piłka nożna: PKO BP Ekstraklasa - mecz: GKS Katowice - Korona Kielce
Byłem królem
programme.desc: Seria przybliżająca sylwetki najlepszych strzelców w historii piłkarskiej ekstraklasy. To wspaniała okazja do przypomnienia sobie sukcesów Włodzimierza Lubańskiego, Grzegorza Laty, Kazimierza Kmiecika, Grzegorza Piechny i Tomasza Frankowskiego. Poznamy różne piłkarskie pokolenia. W latach 60. XX wieku cztery raz z rzędu królem strzelców był Włodzimierz Lubański (Górnik Zabrze). Natomiast w latach 70. królowali Kazimierz Kmiecik (Wisła Kraków) i Grzegorz Lato (Stal Mielec). W czasach bardziej współczesnych cztery tytuły na koncie zanotował Tomasz Frankowski w barwach Wisły Kraków i Jagiellonii Białystok. Nie zabraknie też historii Grzegorza Piechny, niespodziewanego króla strzelców z Korony Kielce w 2006 roku.

programme.title: Piłka nożna: Liga hiszpańska - mecz: UD Levante - Real Sociedad
Żużel: Metalkas 2. Ekstraliga - mecz: FOGO Unia Leszno - Texom Stal Rzeszów
Żużel: PGE Ekstraliga - mecz finałowy fazy play-off: PRES Grupa Deweloperska Toruń - ORLEN OIL Motor Lublin
programme.desc: Fani zespołu z Torunia czekali na tę chwilę od 2016 roku. Po dwóch brązowych medalach mistrzostw Polski z rzędu żużlowcy z grodu Kopernika staną przed szansą zdobycia złota. Dziewięć lat temu przegrali walkę o tytuł ze Stalą Gorzów. Teraz na drodze torunian do sukcesu stanie Motor Lublin, który zdominował rozgrywki Ekstraligi w ostatnich trzech latach. Ich triumf w finale byłby niespodzianką, ale nie sensacją. Drużyna z miasta pierników ma silny skład i dobre zaplecze organizacyjne. Dysponuje też talizmanem w postaci trenera Piotra Barona, który w drugiej dekadzie XXI wieku cztery razy z rzędu zdobył mistrzostwo kraju z Unią Leszno. Czy to wystarczy, by zdetronizować ekipę na czele z Bartoszem Zmarzlikiem.

programme.title: Narciarstwo dowolne: Zawody Pucharu Świata w Secret Garden - aerials
Piłka nożna: Liga Konferencji UEFA - mecz: FC Noah - Legia Warszawa
Piłka nożna: Liga Konferencji UEFA - mecz: Jagiellonia Białystok - KuPS Kuopio
programme.desc: Na półmetku fazy zasadniczej Ligi Konferencji Duma Podlasia zajmuje trzynaste miejsce, gwarantujące rozstawienie w fazie play-off. Podopieczni Adriana Siemieńca pozostają niepokonani, ale z ostatniego występu nie mogą być dumni. Zaledwie zremisowali bowiem z macedońską Shkendiją 1:1, a wyrównującego gola zdobyli w dziesiątej minucie doliczonego czasu gry. Przed Jagiellonią spotkanie z KuPS Kuopio, tak jak ona mającym na koncie pięć punktów. Zespół z Finlandii wyjdzie na boisko w Białymstoku podbudowany zwycięstwem 3:1 nad Slovanem Bratysława w poprzedniej kolejce.

programme.title: Atleci
programme.desc: Atleci to magazyn dla wszystkich, którzy kochają sport. W programie relacje z imprez, rozmowy z gwiazdami, a także praktyczne porady, ciekawi ludzie i wyjątkowe miejsca na sportowej mapie Polski.

Piłka nożna: Liga Konferencji UEFA - mecz: Jagiellonia Białystok - KuPS Kuopio
programme.desc: Na półmetku fazy zasadniczej Ligi Konferencji Duma Podlasia zajmuje trzynaste miejsce, gwarantujące rozstawienie w fazie play-off. Podopieczni Adriana Siemieńca pozostają niepokonani, ale z ostatniego występu nie mogą być dumni. Zaledwie zremisowali bowiem z macedońską Shkendiją 1:1, a wyrównującego gola zdobyli w dziesiątej minucie doliczonego czasu gry. Przed Jagiellonią spotkanie z KuPS Kuopio, tak jak ona mającym na koncie pięć punktów. Zespół z Finlandii wyjdzie na boisko w Białymstoku podbudowany zwycięstwem 3:1 nad Slovanem Bratysława w poprzedniej kolejce.

Archiwum Ligi Europy UEFA
programme.desc: W programie widzowie zobaczą fragmenty pamiętnych spotkań rozegranych w ramach rozgrywek Ligi Europy UEFA. Od sezonu 2009/2010 roku rozgrywki te zastąpiły dotychczasowy Puchar UEFA. Autorzy szczególną uwagę zwracają na mecze z udziałem polskich klubów. Pierwszą drużyną z Polski, która wywalczyła prawo gry w fazie grupowej LE, był Lech Poznań, później sztuka ta udała się także Wiśle Kraków i Legii Warszawa. Największym sukcesem, jak dotąd był awans do 1/16 finału Lecha w sezonie 2010/2011, Legii i Wisły w sezonie 2011/2012 oraz Legii Warszawa w sezonie 2014/2015.

programme.title: Siatkówka mężczyzn: Klubowe mistrzostwa świata - mecz półfinałowy: Aluron CMC Warta Zawiercie - Osaka Bluteon
programme.desc: Jurajscy Rycerze w fazie grupowej rozgrywanych w Belem klubowych mistrzostw świata odnieśli komplet zwycięstw. Najpierw stoczyli wyrównany bój z Voleiem Renata (3:2), a następnie rozbili w trzech setach Al-Rayyan i Praia Clube. Na drodze Warty do finału stanie Osaka Bluteon. Wicemistrz Azji wypadł bardzo dobrze w poprzednich meczach turnieju w Brazylii. Pokonał obrońcę tytułu Sadę Cruzeiro i Asswehly SC 3:0, a Sir Sicomie Monini Perugia uległ dopiero po tie-breaku. Miguel Angel Lopez Castro i spółka z pewnością postawią podopiecznym Michała Winiarskiego trudne warunki.

programme.desc: Program poświęcony rozgrywkom Eredivisie. Widzowie zobaczą w nim skróty meczów ostatniej kolejki, najładniejsze bramki i parady bramkarskie oraz wiele ciekawostek związanych z ligą holenderską.

programme.title: Piłka nożna: Superpuchar Włoch - mecz finałowy: SSC Napoli - Bologna FC
Piłka nożna: Liga Konferencji UEFA - mecz: Omonia FC - Raków Częstochowa
programme.desc: Medaliki są jedną z trzech drużyn w Lidze Konferencji, która w rundzie zasadniczej nie doznała jeszcze porażki. Częstochowianie mają już zapewnioną grę w fazie pucharowej, ale nie zamierzają się tym zadowolić. Liczą bowiem na bezpośredni awans do 1/8 finału, a ten da im miejsce w najlepszej ósemce na zakończenie fazy ligowej rozgrywek. Przed starciem z Omonią, trenowaną przez byłego szkoleniowca Legii, Henninga Berga, zajmują trzecią lokatę w tabeli. Zespół z Nikozji jest piętnasty, a na koncie ma osiem punktów, trzy mniej od Rakowa.
